summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Brooklyn Avenue, from East Fifty-second Street to a point two hundred fifty (250) feet north of the north margin of East Fifty-second Street, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing therein sewers of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, openings, manholes, lampholes, catch basins and other appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 136 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said City, approved December 6, 1899.
